intro: Microcorys macredieana, commonly known as the Macredie's microcorys, is a rare flowering plant native to the highland regions of New Zealand. It belongs to the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. The plant has a compact growth habit with hairy stems and leaves that are narrow and leathery. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or forested areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
